title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Prerequisites > What Do You Need? > RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite Required Accessories
content:
1. [**RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite**](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/rak7258-micro-gateway?utm_source=RAK7258Lite&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)
2. [Ethernet Cable](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/ethernet-cable-gland?utm_source=EthernetCableGland&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore) (RJ-45 Port)
3. A Windows/Mac OS/Linux Computer
parent_content:
1. [**RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite**](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/rak7258-micro-gateway?utm_source=RAK7258Lite&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)
2. [Ethernet Cable](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/ethernet-cable-gland?utm_source=EthernetCableGland&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore) (RJ-45 Port)
3. A Windows/Mac OS/Linux Computer  
> **WARNING:** The SIM card slot of the cellular versions is not hot-swappable. Make sure the gateway is switched off before inserting or ejecting the SIM card.

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Wall Mounting Guide > Mounting RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite on a Wall
content:
1. Use a **5-millimeter drill bit** to drill 2 holes on a wall. Follow the dimensions on the image as a guideline for spacing the holes. When done insert the screw anchors into the wall.  
> **Image:** RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite Bottom Panel  
2. Install the screws into the wall, leaving about **3-millimeters** of clearance.  
> **Image:** RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite Wall Screw Arrangement
parent_content:
1. Use a **5-millimeter drill bit** to drill 2 holes on a wall. Follow the dimensions on the image as a guideline for spacing the holes. When done insert the screw anchors into the wall.  
> **Image:** RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite Bottom Panel  
2. Install the screws into the wall, leaving about **3-millimeters** of clearance.  
> **Image:** RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite Wall Screw Arrangement  
3. Insert the screw heads into the hanging holes located on the gateway back-plate, then gently pull down to complete the installation  
> **Image:** RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite Wall Attachment Guide

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Power on the Gateway > RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite: Attaching the LoRa Antenna and Powering On
content:
1. Attach the LoRa Antenna  
First and foremost, screw on the antenna to the SMA connector back panel of the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite  
> **WARNING:** Do not power the device if the LoRa Antenna port has been left open to avoid potential damage in the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite.  
2. **Power** the Gateway **ON**
parent_content:
1. Attach the LoRa Antenna  
First and foremost, screw on the antenna to the SMA connector back panel of the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite  
> **WARNING:** Do not power the device if the LoRa Antenna port has been left open to avoid potential damage in the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite.  
2. **Power** the Gateway **ON**  
It is recommended to use the **12V DC adapter** that comes with the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite. Optionally, you can use your own **PoE cable** and **injector** since the device supports PoE.

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Power on the Gateway > RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite: Attaching the LoRa Antenna and Powering On
content:
2. **Power** the Gateway **ON**  
It is recommended to use the **12V DC adapter** that comes with the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite. Optionally, you can use your own **PoE cable** and **injector** since the device supports PoE.

> **WARNING:** Do not power the device if the LoRa Antenna port has been left open to avoid potential damage in the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite.  
2. **Power** the Gateway **ON**  
It is recommended to use the **12V DC adapter** that comes with the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite. Optionally, you can use your own **PoE cable** and **injector** since the device supports PoE.

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Power on the Gateway > Status LED Indicators > RAK7258 LED Status Indications [TABLE]
parent_content:
| LEDs | Status Indication                                                                                                             |
| ---- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| PWR  | Power Indicator, LED is on when the device is powered                                                                         |
| ETH  | **ON**– link is up, **OFF** – link is down, **Flashing** – Data is being transferred                                          |
| LoRa | **ON** - LoRa module status is up, **OFF** – LoRa module status is down, **Flashing** – LoRa module data is being transferred |
| ACT  | Reserved for future use                                                                                                       |
| STAT | Reserved for future use                                                                                                       |
| WLAN | **AP Mode** : **ON** - WLAN status is up, **Flashing** - Data is being transferred                                            |
|      | **STA Mode** : **Slow Flashing** (1Hz) - Disconnected, **ON** - Connected, **Flashing** - Data is being transferred           |

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Power on the Gateway > Reset Key Functions > Reset Key Functions [TABLE]
content:
The function of the **Reset** key is as follows:  
1. **Short press**: Restarts the Gateway
2. **Long press** (**5 seconds and above**): Restore Factory Settings
parent_content:
The function of the **Reset** key is as follows:  
1. **Short press**: Restarts the Gateway
2. **Long press** (**5 seconds and above**): Restore Factory Settings

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Access the Gateway > Accessing the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite Gateway
content:
In this section, several ways of accessing the gateway are provided to have different alternatives for you to choose form depending on the availability of the requirements needed.  
> **WARNING:** Do not power the device if the LoRa Antenna port has been left open to avoid potential damage in the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite."
parent_content:
In this section, several ways of accessing the gateway are provided to have different alternatives for you to choose form depending on the availability of the requirements needed.  
> **WARNING:** Do not power the device if the LoRa Antenna port has been left open to avoid potential damage in the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite."

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Access the Gateway > Wi-Fi AP Mode > Connect to RAK7258 Gateway in Wi-Fi AP Mode
content:
By default, the Gateway will work in Wi-Fi AP Mode which means that you can find an SSID named like "**RAK7258_XXXX**" on your PC's Wi-Fi Network List. "**XXXX**" is the last two bytes of the Gateway MAC address.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
No password is required to connect via Wi-Fi  
* Using your preferred Web browser, login the credentials provided below:
* **Browser Address**: `192.168.230.1`
* **Username**: root
* **Password**: root  
> **Image:** Web User Interface Log-in
parent_content:

> **TIP:** NOTE
No password is required to connect via Wi-Fi  
* Using your preferred Web browser, login the credentials provided below:
* **Browser Address**: `192.168.230.1`
* **Username**: root
* **Password**: root  
> **Image:** Web User Interface Log-in

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Access the Gateway > WAN Port DHCP IP > Accessing Web Management Platform via DHCP IP Address
content: When DHCP Server is in the network where the gateway WAN interface is located, the WAN interface can automatically get the IP address. After inquiring the IP address of the gateway through DHCP Server, the WEB management platform of the gateway can be accessed through the DHCP IP address of WAN interface. Same as with the Wi-Fi AP mode, the same IP Address: `192.168.230.1` shall be used to access the **Web Management Platform**.
parent_content: When DHCP Server is in the network where the gateway WAN interface is located, the WAN interface can automatically get the IP address. After inquiring the IP address of the gateway through DHCP Server, the WEB management platform of the gateway can be accessed through the DHCP IP address of WAN interface. Same as with the Wi-Fi AP mode, the same IP Address: `192.168.230.1` shall be used to access the **Web Management Platform**.

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Access the Internet > Connect through Wi-Fi > Enable Wireless Client and Connect to Wi-Fi Network
content:
Go into the **Network>Wi-Fi Menu** and make sure to enable the **Wireless Client** as it is disabled initially. Enter or click "**Scan**" to choose your **ESSSID**, select the right **Encryption** method and enter the correct **Key**.  
> **Image:** Connect through Wi-Fi Credentials  
> **TIP:** NOTE
parent_content:
Go into the **Network>Wi-Fi Menu** and make sure to enable the **Wireless Client** as it is disabled initially. Enter or click "**Scan**" to choose your **ESSSID**, select the right **Encryption** method and enter the correct **Key**.  
> **Image:** Connect through Wi-Fi Credentials  
> **TIP:** NOTE
Assuming you have entered the correct parameter values you should get an IP address assigned by your Wi-Fi router's (AP) built-in DHCP server. You can use this new IP address to log in via a web browser (same way as in AP mode).

> **Image:** Connect through Wi-Fi Credentials  
> **TIP:** NOTE
Assuming you have entered the correct parameter values you should get an IP address assigned by your Wi-Fi router's (AP) built-in DHCP server. You can use this new IP address to log in via a web browser (same way as in AP mode).

title: RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > RAK7258 Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Access the Internet > Connect through Ethernet/PoE > Connect RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite to Router via Ethernet
content:
Connect the **Ethernet Port (ETH)** of the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite via an Ethernet cable to your **Router**. The router’s DHCP server should assign an IP Address to the Gateway. You can change the default settings below if you wish (details in the User Manual).  
> **Image:** Connect through Ethernet Settings
parent_content:
Connect the **Ethernet Port (ETH)** of the RAK7258 WisGate Edge Lite via an Ethernet cable to your **Router**. The router’s DHCP server should assign an IP Address to the Gateway. You can change the default settings below if you wish (details in the User Manual).  
> **Image:** Connect through Ethernet Settings
